alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 17 at 3:44PM CDT until July 17 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Webster County in southwestern Missouri... Western Wright County in southwestern Missouri... Northwestern Douglas County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 344 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Niangua, or 8 miles east of Marshfield, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Marshfield, Seymour, Mansfield, Norwood, Hartville, Duncan, Diggins, Grovespring, Dogwood and Odin. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
